attributes.action: Reconsider the changes to DLA / PIP
attributes.additional_details:
The changes to DLA and to introduce PIP are disgusting. The government claim they want to reduce the cost of DLA by 20% - that would leave many people like myself with no DLA, meaning no much needed care and will probably cost the NHS more. Or is it acceptable for a disabled person to go without basic needs through no fault of their own?

The new system won't save any money all - in fact, it'll cost more - due to medicals and people needing to appeal.

The government claim they want to help disabled people who need it the most - there are people out there who, whilst their only care need is cooking a meal, they STILL need this help a lot - or is living on microwave meals acceptable?

They want to remove lower rate care - why? Or is the government now denying that these people need help?

All the government is trying to do is save money - why take it away from the people who need it the most?
